intro: Cucurbita pepo subvar. nigra, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a herbaceous vine that produces small, dark green, edible fruits. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, which are typically light to dark green in color. The fruits, which are usually about 2–3 inches in diameter, turn black when mature. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible berries.
